page.title: 08St Andrews Church Tongue
page.content: St Andrews church was built in 1690 on the site of an older church. The old est grave is around 1690. It is a Mackay church and the crypt and plaques on the walls bear witness to that fact. It is regularly visited by members of the Clan Mackay whose chief is Lord Reay.The church is small and whitewashed with crowstepped gables. The gallery and the {Laird's loft } are reached by an outside stair and not from inside the building. The church is in the shape of a cross but parts of the arms of the cross have been sealed off and are now side rooms.One of these is the vestry where the minister prepares for services and the other is used for meetings.
